title: Inventory & Logistics Coordinator (part-time)
content:
Position Overview: MLB is seeking an Inventory & Logistics Coordinator to join its Logistics Team.
The Inventory & Logistics Coordinator will be responsible for shipping and receiving gear for various technology infrastructure projects. The individual would be responsible for facilitating supply chain management—ensuring the proper flow of equipment and gear to MLB ballparks and facilities. This position will focus on supporting day-to-day logistical needs for all the internal customers that rely on the MLB-Logistics team.
The ideal candidate should possess a low-ego-roll-up-your-sleeves approach to a fast-paced environment.Responsibilities: 
Shipping & Receiving:

Verifying of package contents crossed referenced with shipping list
Preparation and packaging of equipment for remote operations
Receiving of packages and equipment

Asset Management:

Inventory and organization of current equipment
Inventory and organization of acquired equipment
Data entry of asset tags and serial number into inventory system

Inventory Management:

Inventory and stock proper levels of equipment, media and tools
Miscellaneous duties as assigned

 Requirements: 

Familiarity with UPS, FedEX, USPS, SOS and other logistics carriers
Familiarity with TSA and shipping policies of specialized or hazardous equipment
Familiarity with customs and international shipping regulations and tariffs
Extremely strong communication skills required
Experience in working in facilities requiring time sensitive shipping and receiving needs
Must be highly organized
Ability to lift and handle at least 50lbs
Ability to walk long distances, remain on your feet for extended periods of time, kneel and crawl
Ability to work holidays

Travel Requirements:

Less than 5%

 
Per the NYC pay transparency law, the hiring range for this position is an hourly rate of $25.00 to $25.00. The actual offer will carefully consider a wide range of factors, including your work experience, education, skills and any other factors Major League Baseball (MLB) considers relevant to the hiring decision.
 California Residents: Have you reviewed our California Consumer Privacy Act Policy ?

A “relative” is defined as a spouse, domestic partner, brother or sister, parent, child, grandparent, grandchild, great-grandchild, aunt, uncle, niece, nephew, cousin, or in-law or “step” of these family relationships.
